intro: Leucospermum hamatum, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright orange to red floral display. The plant produces small, fluffy seed heads that are adapted for dispersal by wind. It typically grows in open, sunny environments and is well-suited to coastal areas. The flowers bloom in spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
